be.chrisv.dte.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • be.chrisv.dte.model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.util.Observable
    Model of the App, contain all the data

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model()
        Empty Model constructor. Initialize the history and set all the instance variables to -1000 (Default state).

      • Model

        public Model(int currentTemperature,
             int thresholdTemperature,
             int alertLevel)
      throws UnknowAlertLevelException
        Full Model constructor
        Parameters:
        currentTemperature - Must be an int and be the current temperature given by the sensors
        thresholdTemperature - Must be an int and be the temperature who trigger the alert
        alertLevel - int Must be greater than 0 and smaller than 3
        Throws:
        UnknowAlertLevelException - When the alertLevel parametter is strictly smaller than 0 or stritly bigger than 3

      • Model

        public Model(int currentTemperature,
             int thresholdTemperature)
        Model constructor with current and threshold temperature. Automaticaly calculate the AlertLevel
        Parameters:
        currentTemperature - Must be an int and be the current temperature given by the sensors
        thresholdTemperature - Must be an int and be the temperature who trigger the alert

        public void checkAlertLevel()

      • getAlertLevel

        public int getAlertLevel()
        Get the current AlertLevel
        Returns:
        int greater than 0 and smaller than 3 {0, 1, 2, 3}

      • setAlertLevel

        public void setAlertLevel(int alertLevel)
                   throws UnknowAlertLevelException
        Set the alertLevel and record it on the AlertLevelHistory HashMap
        Parameters:
        alertLevel - int int Must be greater than 0 and smaller than 3 {0, 1, 2, 3}
        Throws:
        UnknowAlertLevelException - When the parametter is strictly smaller than 0 and stritly bigger than 3

      • getAlertLevelHistory

                                                                               throws EmptyHistoryException
        Get the alert level history
        Returns:
        HashMap(Date, Integer) AlertLevel history
        Throws:
        EmptyHistoryException - when there is no AlertLevel recorded yet.

      • addAlertLevelToHistory

        public final void addAlertLevelToHistory(int alertLevel)
                                  throws UnknowAlertLevelException
        Add a record of alertLevel to the history at the current date
        Parameters:
        alertLevel - int int Must be greater than 0 and smaller than 3 {0, 1, 2, 3}
        Throws:
        UnknowAlertLevelException - When the parametter is strictly smaller than 0 and stritly bigger than 3

      • addAlertLevelToHistory

        public final void addAlertLevelToHistory(java.util.Date date,
                                         int alertLevel)
                                  throws UnknowAlertLevelException
        Add a record of alertLevel to the history at the current date
        Parameters:
        date - Date when the alertLevel was set
        alertLevel - int Must be greater than 0 and smaller than 3 {0, 1, 2, 3}
        Throws:
        UnknowAlertLevelException - When the parametter is strictly smaller than 0 and stritly bigger than 3

      • getAlertLevelFromHistory

        public int getAlertLevelFromHistory(java.util.Date date)
                             throws NoHistoryDataAvaliableException
        getAlertLevelFromHistory return the AlertLevel at a date
        Parameters:
        date - Date Must be in the past
        Returns:
        int The AlertLevel at the given date
        Throws:
        NoHistoryDataAvaliableException - when there is no entry at the given date

        Returns:
        HashMap(date, Integer) temperatureHistory
        Throws:
        EmptyHistoryException - when there is no temperature recorded yet

      • getTemperatureFromHistory

        public int getTemperatureFromHistory(java.util.Date date)
                              throws NoHistoryDataAvaliableException
        Get the temperature at a given date
        Parameters:
        date - Must be a date in the past
        Returns:
        int The temperature at the given date
        Throws:
        NoHistoryDataAvaliableException - when there is no temperature recorded at the given date

                                    int temperature)
        Add a temperature at the given date to the temperature history

        date - Date when the temperature was set

      • isAlertLevelCorrect

        public boolean isAlertLevelCorrect(int alertLevel)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
